articles.author: NAJIB JOBAIN, WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli forces bombarded Palestinian refugee camps in central Gaza on Tuesday, residents said, in apparent preparation to expand their ground offensive into a third section of the besieged territory.
articles.title: Israeli forces bombard central Gaza in apparent move toward expanding ground offensive

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and JACK JEFFERY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The doctors gave Shaimaa Nabahin an impossible choice: lose your left leg or risk death. The 22-year-old had been hospitalized in Gaza for around a week, after her ankle was partially severed in an Israeli airstrike, when doctors told her she was suffering from blood poisoning.
articles.title: Lose a limb or risk death? Growing numbers among Gaza's thousands of war-wounded face hard decisions

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI and ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden ordered the U.S. military to carry out retaliatory airstrikes against Iranian-backed militia groups after three U.S.
articles.title: Biden orders strike on Iranian-aligned group after 3 US troops injured in drone attack in Iraq

articles.author: JILL LAWLESS
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — For holding a sign outside a courthouse reminding jurors of their right to acquit defendants, a retiree faces up to two years in prison. For hanging a banner reading Just Stop Oil off a bridge, an engineer got a three-year prison sentence.
articles.title: The right to protest is under threat in Britain, undermining a pillar of democracy

articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — A Russian naval ship in Crimea was damaged in an airstrike by Ukrainian forces, Russia’s Defense Ministry said Tuesday.The landing ship Novocherkassk was hit at a base in the city of Feodosia by plane-launched guided missiles, the ministry said, adding that two Ukrainian fighter jets were destroyed by anti-aircraft fire during the attack.
articles.title: Russian naval ship in Crimea damaged in airstrike by Ukrainian forces, Russian Defense Ministry says

articles.author: MSTYSLAV CHERNOV
articles.description: KHERSON, Ukraine (AP) — Their first battle plan was outdated the moment the dam crumbled. So the Ukrainian special forces officers spent six months adapting their fight to secure a crossing to the other side of the Dnipro River in southern Ukraine.
articles.title: Inside Ukraine's covert Center 73, where clandestine missions shape the war behind the frontline

articles.author: JAMIE STENGLE
articles.description: HASLET, Texas (AP) — Worried about his mother’s health, Jacob Mabil tried for months to persuade her to let him start the process that would take her from a sprawling refugee camp where she had spent almost a decade after fleeing violence in South Sudan.
articles.title: Their lives were torn apart by war in Africa. A family hopes a new US program will help them reunite

articles.author: EDGAR H. CLEMENTE
articles.description: HUIXTLA, Mexico (AP) — Christmas Day meant the same as any other day for thousands of migrants walking through southern Mexico: more trudging under a hot sun.
articles.title: Migrant caravan in southern Mexico marks Christmas Day by trudging onward

articles.description: Conditions were mostly nice this year for travelers flying ahead of and on Christmas, but some naughty disruptions again plagued those flying with Southwest Airlines.For millions of people traveling over the holiday, this year was much better than last.
articles.title: Holiday travel is mostly nice, but with some naughty disruptions again on Southwest Airlines

articles.author: PAUL NEWBERRY
articles.description: They are snippets in time, unforgettable snapshots that gloriously capture the soaring euphoria and gut-wrenching agony of the games we love, not to mention the randomness of a moment that might've gone unnoticed otherwise.
articles.title: AP sports photos of the year capture unforgettable snippets in time from the games we love
